meanings.definition: The act of printing a document or image on a surface that is not directly connected to the original source.
meanings.sent1: The offprinting of the logo on the t-shirt looked faded.
meanings.sent2: The offprinting of the map onto the banner was done with precision.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally did some offprinting on my notebook, and now the text is upside down!
meanings.sent4: Her memories were like offprinting, faint but still visible in the background.
meanings.sent5: The offprinting of the picture on the mug made it a unique gift.

meanings.definition: A method of reproducing text or images by transferring them onto a different medium.
meanings.sent1: The artist used offprinting to create copies of the painting on canvas.
meanings.sent2: Offprinting is commonly used in the production of posters and flyers.
meanings.sent3: The offprinting process felt like magic, turning a digital design into a physical print.
meanings.sent4: His words were like offprinting, spreading across the room and leaving an impression.
meanings.sent5: The offprinting of the photograph on the postcard captured the beauty of the landscape.

meanings.definition: The process of creating multiple copies of a document or image by using a printing press.
meanings.sent1: The offprinting of the book allowed for mass distribution.
meanings.sent2: Offprinting revolutionized the way information could be shared.
meanings.sent3: During the offprinting of the newspaper, the ink ran out, creating a messy print.
meanings.sent4: The offprinting of ideas can lead to a powerful spread of knowledge.
meanings.sent5: The offprinting of the flyer attracted a lot of attention to the event.
